FuncDef:
The aps mode command configures an LMSP working mode.
The undo aps mode command restores the default LMSP working mode.
By default, LMSP is working in 1+1 unidirectional mode.
CLIs: aps mode { one2one bidirection | one-plus-one { unidirection | bidirection } }

ParaDef.Info:
Configures LMSP to work in 1:1 mode to allow only the working link to transmit traffic. The protection link only carries traffic if the working link is faulty.
-

Configures LMSP to work in bidirectional mode so that if an interface fails, both the sender and receiver switch their traffic to the protection link.
-

Configures LMSP to work in 1+1 mode to allow both the working and protection links to transmit traffic.
-

Configures LMSP to work in unidirectional mode so that if an optical fiber to an interface fails, only the receiver switches its traffic to the protection link.
-

ExtraInfo:
The MC-LMSP automatic 1:1 bidirectional switching mode and a single ICB PW can be configured together. The MC-LMSP automatic 1+1 switching mode and dual ICB PWs can be configured together. These configuration combinations allow MC-LMSP to work together with PW redundancy.
Before you configure an interface as the protection interface of an APS group, add the interface to the APS group.
